discussion.content:
It is D !
LPT1 is a local parallel Port for a local connected Printer. Since 20 years we do not longer use that but USB to connect local printer. But here they ask about a shared printer.

questions.question_text:
A user received a new workstation but is unable to print successfully to the shared network printer. Other users are able to print without issues. Some recent OS updates were applied to the workstation, and all other services are working fine. The technician checks the printer's properties and notices it is configured for
LPT1. Which of the following should be performed NEXT to troubleshoot the issue?

discussion.content: The correct answer is D. A tone generator and a probe.

Selected Answer: D
definitely the correct answer....thx for your help guys

Selected Answer: D
Tone Generator and Probe to find out which port in the patchpanel is connected to the jack a that desk

Selected Answer: D
tone generator and probe, for sure

Selected Answer: D
A tone generator and a probe.

Selected Answer: D
definitely D

Ans is D
A tone generator and probe tool is used to trace a cable from one end to the other.
This may be necessary when the cables are bundled and have not been labeled
properly. This device is also known as a "Fox and Hound" or "toner and probe." The
tone generator is used to apply a signal on the cable. The probe is used to detect the
signal and follow the cable over ceilings and through ducts or identify it from within the
rest of the bundle.
Correct answer is D

choices.D: A tone generator and a probe

questions.question_text: A manager reports there is no network connectivity at a desk that has been empty for several months. The jack on the port has no label. Which of the following would be BEST for a technician to use to trace the port connection back to the wiring closet?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The orientation setting controls the direction of the printout on the page, either portrait or landscape. By changing the orientation setting to landscape mode, the printer will print all jobs in landscape orientation, as requested by the user. The quality setting controls the resolution and print quality, collate controls the order in which the pages are printed, and duplex controls whether the printer prints on both sides of the paper. These settings do not affect the orientation of the printout.

Selected Answer: A
The orientation setting controls the direction of the printout on the page, either portrait or landscape. By changing the orientation setting to landscape mode, the printer will print all jobs in landscape orientation, as requested by the user. The quality setting controls the resolution and print quality, collate controls the order in which the pages are printed, and duplex controls whether the printer prints on both sides of the paper. These settings do not affect the orientation of the printout.
yes: A

questions.question_text: A printer is printing all jobs in portrait mode, and the user needs to change it to landscape mode only. Which of the following settings should the user modify on the printer?

discussion.content: I believe the correct answer is B. because the key word of the question is " what should a technician do FIRST" which mean the technician has to Verify the user is sending the document to the correct printer.
The answer is B. You should always check if the issue is not a "user error". It is not A, because, after the user switch to another printer, the PC's print spooler worked properly.
B. Verify the user is sending the document to the correct printer queue.
Do these questions actually come up in the exam as I did and apart from the case study did not see hardly any?

comments.content: did you actually not get a single question from here on the exam? (Apart from the case study)

discussion.content:
I've been in desktop support for 7 years, answer B happens quite often and would be the most correct in my opinion. If the user is able to print to another printer without any issues then the Print Spooler should be functioning correctly. 

Usually, if the user cannot print to ANY printer it ends up being the Spooler or depending on if the other printers are the same model the drivers could be corrupted. 
Ex.) HP uses universal print drivers for almost all their enterprise printers, so the drivers are shared, which means if you cannot print to any HP printer then the drivers are most likely corrupted (happens often on a large user base).

comments.content: you are totally right, im so confused right now .........
in a big office settings, 3+ printers are not uncommon just because they printed to another doesn't mean they started at the correct one
Tenia 2 impresoras y 1 de esas le imprime otra no.

discussion.content: If it says "the user sends the document to another printer", that means that he already send it to the correct one, so that eliminates option B. I think "A" should be the answer!
Go back to troubleshooting step answer is correct
Agree, A can be the right one.

comments.content:
Other users are having no issues which means no issues with the server. Eliminate C and D

The user with the issue can print to another printer which means the spooler service is working. Eliminate A

I personally don't understand how B would help though.
Spooler service is service present on each client PC, so if anything is wrong with spooler service you should restart it and try again.

discussion.content: Why is it B shouldn't it be A?

questions.question_text:
A user is having a problem with printing a specific document type.
The network printer OCP shows that the printer is online with no errors. Other users are not having the same issue. The user sends the document to another printer and the document prints.
Which of the following should a technician do FIRST in troubleshooting the problem?

choices.C: Have each user send the same document to the correct printer queue.
choices.D: Stop and restart the print server queues, and then have the user resend the document.
choices.B: Verify the user is sending the document to the correct printer queue.
choices.A: Stop and restart the PC print spooler service.

discussion.content:
For multiple VMs, I would choose RAM as the most important, but it's only 1 VM so RAM should not be an issue.
I agree with C. Disk Space

How large is the average CAD file?
Of those 13,700 are DWG files. The largest is 38MB the smallest is 5KB. A typical drawing for us is about 500KB to 1.5MB.
